newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-STEWART, HOCH SHARE NISSAN OPEN FIRST ROUND LEAD.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-STEWART, HOCH SHARE NISSAN OPEN FIRST ROUND LEAD.

text.p: Payne Stewart, playing only his second tournament since undergoing December elbow surgery, fired a six-under par 65 Thursday to earn a share of the first-round lead with Scott Hoch at the Nissan Open golf tournament.
Stewart birdied the last two holes at the Riviera Country Club to conclude a back nine of four-under par 32, while Hoch birdied four of his final six holes to meet Stewart atop the leaderboard.
Hoch and Stewart stood one stroke ahead of Briton Nick Faldo and Paul Goydos, who each shot five-under 66s.
Mark O'Meara, seeking to win his third consecutive tournament, opened with a four-under 67 and was tied with Tom Watson, Fred Funk, Frank Lickliter and Tom Purtzer.
Tiger Woods returned to the U.S. Tour after playing tournaments in Thailand and Australia and shot a one-under 70.
"I just missed three or four six-footers on the front," Stewart said. "My caddie told me I was moving my head on putts, so I held it still and started making some."
Hoch, resuming his season after a four-week hiatus, fired a six-under par 29 for his back nine -- the front nine at Riviera. He toured holes 10 through 18 at even par.
"It's surprising after four weeks off," Hoch said. "It took me awhile to get going this morning. But I hit a lot of good shots today."
Faldo, who also began on the back nine, jump-started his round with an eagle-3 at the par-5 11th hole.
"I played solid," said Faldo of his bogey-free round, "as good as I've played in a long time.
"It was nice. I've been working hard, working on my swing, working on everything. I've had some great sessions with (golf guru) David Leadbetter."
